results.title: Kiewa catchment farm tree group: a community in action
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Rural Affairs. North Central Media Unit, John Atkins and Ian Blythman
results.brief_description: The Kiewa community formed a tree planting group to combat the problems of land degradation due to the impact of agricultural practices, the effect of tourisism in the area and erosion. This video shows how a small community in the alpine area of north-east Victoria, worked together to deal with an environmental problem.

results.title: Horse breaking
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Agrifilm
results.brief_description: Depicts 72 year-old Kel Jeffrey applying his unique and humane method of gaining a horse’s confidence to the point where it will allow a saddle to be placed on its back and a person to ride it.

results.title: The Hearing Process
results.creator_credit: Public Service Board of Victoria and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Rural Affairs
results.brief_description: The Hearing Process is a function of the Victorian Public Service Board. It is freely available to all present and former officers and employees of the Public Service. This process is designed to protect the rights of all Public Service Officers and employees, and to enable staff to seek review of decisions which adversely affect them, other than decisions where another review or appeal body exists. The Victorian Public Service employes approximately 40,000 full and part time people. This video outlines the processes involved in presenting a case against unfair or inequitable treatment in the workplace.

results.title: Organics: food for thought
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Rural Affairs, Mike Laker and Jim Testa
results.brief_description: Organic farmers work with nature rather than against it, a process of positive cooperation with the soil, without the intervention of chemicals, in order to produce a quality product. Filmed on location in Victoria, this video covers the production, marketing, export potential and labelling of organic produce in Australia. It features citrus grower, Robert Ridgewell; bio-dynamic wheat/sheep farmer, John Greenwood; vegetable grower, Neville Cann and Ian Diamond, organic wholesaler.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Rural Affairs, Mike Laker and Jim Testa

results.title: The Oscars slap
results.brief_description: There are no winners in this Academy Award moment. Even those who took home Oscars had their achievement overshadowed by Will Smith’s startling assault on Chris Rock. When the internet should’ve been buzzing about Troy Kotsur winning the second Oscar awarded to a Deaf performer, or Jane Campion being only the third woman to win for Best Director, it was instead saturated by hot takes, memes and outrage – either for or against Rock’s joke or Smith’s reaction – in an ongoing feedback loop between broadcaster, viewer and meme-maker, which played out in real time during the ceremony.

constellations_other.name: Ana Kokkinos
constellations_other.description: The films and TV works of Ana Kokkinos often explore the experiences of second-generation Australians, queer identities and class. Since beginning her career in the early 90s, those stories have started to appear more frequently on Australian screens.

results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

There are no winners in this Academy Award moment. Even those who took home Oscars had their achievement overshadowed by Will Smith’s startling assault on Chris Rock. When the internet should’ve been buzzing about Troy Kotsur winning the second Oscar awarded to a Deaf performer, Ariana DeBose being the first openly queer woman of colour to take one home, or Jane Campion being only the third woman to win for Best Director, it was instead saturated by hot takes, memes and outrage – either for or against Rock’s joke or Smith’s reaction – in an ongoing feedback loop between broadcaster, viewer and meme-maker, which played out in real time during the ceremony.
description_for_label: There are no winners in this Academy Award moment. Even those who took home Oscars had their achievement overshadowed by Will Smith’s startling assault on Chris Rock. When the internet should’ve been buzzing about Troy Kotsur winning the second Oscar awarded to a Deaf performer, or Jane Campion being only the third woman to win for Best Director, it was instead saturated by hot takes, memes and outrage – either for or against Rock’s joke or Smith’s reaction – in an ongoing feedback loop between broadcaster, viewer and meme-maker, which played out in real time during the ceremony.

details.label: Curatorial section
display_values: The Story of the Moving Image → Moving Minds → MM-09. Catch of the Day

results.title: [Remix: 1956 Melbourne Olympic Games]
results.brief_description:
This remix features footage of the 1956 Melbourne Olympic Games including the Olympic torch relay, opening ceremony at the MCG, various events and some elaborate decorations displayed in the CBD during the games.

The video was made using clips from home movies and professional documentary footage preserved in the ACMI Collection.

results.title: Spotlights: Bruna Papandrea
results.brief_description: Eric Banadinović AM, known professionally as Eric Bana, is an Australian actor. He began his career in the sketch comedy series Full Frontal (1993–97) before gaining notice in the comedy/drama The Castle (1997) before gaining critical acclaim as the lead in Chopper (2000).
results.description: Bruna Papandrea is an Australian film and television producer and the founder of production company Made Up Stories, which is set to release the upcoming adaptation of Liane Moriarty’s Nine Perfect Strangers. Prior to Made Up Stories, Papandrea co-founded the production company, Pacific Standard, with Reese Witherspoon, which produced Gone Girl and Big Little Lies.
description_for_label: Bruna Papandrea is an Australian film and television producer and the founder of production company Made Up Stories, which is set to release the upcoming adaptation of Liane Moriarty’s Nine Perfect Strangers. Prior to Made Up Stories, Papandrea co-founded the production company, Pacific Standard, with Reese Witherspoon, which produced Gone Girl and Big Little Lies.

results.title: Spotlights: Eric Bana
results.brief_description: Eric Banadinović AM, known professionally as Eric Bana, is an Australian actor. He began his career in the sketch comedy series Full Frontal (1993–97) before gaining notice in the comedy/drama The Castle (1997) before gaining critical acclaim as the lead in Chopper (2000).

constellations_primary.name: Eric Bana
constellations_primary.description: There must be something that draws Australian creatives like Eric Bana to darker material as they shoot to stardom overseas. Australia's penal colony past perhaps?

results.description: Eric Bana is an Australian actor who began his career in the sketch comedy series Full Frontal (1993–97) before gaining notice in the comedy/drama The Castle (1997). Soon after he gained critical recognition in the biographical crime film Chopper (2000). Eric discusses the influence of the car on the Australian psyche.

Soon after he gained critical recognition in the biographical crime film Chopper (2000). Eric discusses the influence of the car on the Australian psyche.
